question: Which country's major power source is the "Nesjavellir Geothermal Power Station"?
explanation: Iceland's major power source is the "Nesjavellir Geothermal Power Station". The Nesjavellir Geothermal Power Station (NGPS) is the second-largest geothermal power station in Iceland. The facility is located 177 m above sea level in the southwestern part of the country, near Thingvellir and the Hengill Volcano.
